segment.source: The Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.0 client stores its configuration in the registry.
segment.target: The Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.0 client stores its configuration in the registry.

segment.source: You can gather some useful information about the client if you understand the format of data in the registry.
segment.target: You can gather some useful information about the client if you understand the format of data in the registry.

segment.source: You can also configure many client actions by changing registry entries.
segment.target: You can also configure many client actions by changing registry entries.

segment.source: This topic lists the App-V 5.0 Client configuration settings and explains their uses.
segment.target: This topic lists the App-V 5.0 Client configuration settings and explains their uses.

segment.source: You can use PowerShell to modify the client configuration settings.
segment.target: You can use PowerShell to modify the client configuration settings.

segment.source: For more information about using PowerShell and App-V 5.0 see Administering App-V by Using PowerShell.
segment.target: For more information about using PowerShell and App-V 5.0 see Administering App-V by Using PowerShell.

segment.source: The following table displays information about the App-V 5.0 client configuration settings:
segment.target: The following table displays information about the App-V 5.0 client configuration settings:

segment.source: Disabled Policy State Keys and Values
segment.target: Disabled Policy State Keys and Values

segment.source: Specifies directory where all new applications and updates will be installed.
segment.target: Specifies directory where all new applications and updates will be installed.

segment.source: Policy value not written (same as Not Configured)
segment.target: Policy value not written (same as Not Configured)

segment.source: Overrides source location for downloading package content.
segment.target: Overrides source location for downloading package content.

segment.source: Policy value not written (same as Not Configured)
segment.target: Policy value not written (same as Not Configured)

segment.source: This setting controls whether virtualized applications are launched on Windows 8 machines connected via a metered network connection (For example, 4G).
segment.target: This setting controls whether virtualized applications are launched on Windows 8 machines connected via a metered network connection (For example, 4G).

segment.source: Specifies the number of times to retry a dropped session.
segment.target: Specifies the number of times to retry a dropped session.

segment.source: Policy value not written (same as Not Configured)
segment.target: Policy value not written (same as Not Configured)

segment.source: Specifies the number of seconds between attempts to reestablish a dropped session.
segment.target: Specifies the number of seconds between attempts to reestablish a dropped session.

segment.source: Policy value not written (same as Not Configured)
segment.target: Policy value not written (same as Not Configured)

segment.source: Specifies how new packages should be loaded automatically by App-V on a specific computer.
segment.target: Specifies how new packages should be loaded automatically by App-V on a specific computer.

segment.source: Policy value not written (same as Not Configured)
segment.target: Policy value not written (same as Not Configured)

segment.source: Specifies the CLSID for a compatible implementation of the IAppvPackageLocationProvider interface.
segment.target: Specifies the CLSID for a compatible implementation of the IAppvPackageLocationProvider interface.

segment.source: Policy value not written (same as Not Configured)
segment.target: Policy value not written (same as Not Configured)

segment.source: Specifies the path to a valid certificate in the certificate store.
segment.target: Specifies the path to a valid certificate in the certificate store.

segment.source: Policy value not written (same as Not Configured)
segment.target: Policy value not written (same as Not Configured)

segment.source: Verifies Server certificate revocation status before steaming using HTTPS.
segment.target: Verifies Server certificate revocation status before steaming using HTTPS.

segment.source: Specifies that streamed package contents will be not be saved to the local hard disk.
segment.target: Specifies that streamed package contents will be not be saved to the local hard disk.

segment.source: This setting cannot be modified using the set-AppvclientConfiguration cmdLet.
segment.target: This setting cannot be modified using the set-AppvclientConfiguration cmdLet.

segment.source: You must use the Set-AppvPublishingServer cmdlet.
segment.target: You must use the Set-AppvPublishingServer cmdlet.

segment.source: Displays the name of publishing server.
segment.target: Displays the name of publishing server.

segment.source: Policy value not written (same as Not Configured)
segment.target: Policy value not written (same as Not Configured)

segment.source: This setting cannot be modified using the set-AppvclientConfiguration cmdLet.
segment.target: This setting cannot be modified using the set-AppvclientConfiguration cmdLet.

segment.source: You must use the Set-AppvPublishingServer cmdlet.
segment.target: You must use the Set-AppvPublishingServer cmdlet.

segment.source: Displays the URL of publishing server.
segment.target: Displays the URL of publishing server.

segment.source: Policy value not written (same as Not Configured)
segment.target: Policy value not written (same as Not Configured)

segment.source: This setting cannot be modified using the set-AppvclientConfiguration cmdLet.
segment.target: This setting cannot be modified using the set-AppvclientConfiguration cmdLet.

segment.source: You must use the Set-AppvPublishingServer cmdlet.
segment.target: You must use the Set-AppvPublishingServer cmdlet.

segment.source: This setting cannot be modified using the set-AppvclientConfiguration cmdLet.
segment.target: This setting cannot be modified using the set-AppvclientConfiguration cmdLet.

segment.source: You must use the Set-AppvPublishingServer cmdlet.
segment.target: You must use the Set-AppvPublishingServer cmdlet.

segment.source: Triggers a global publishing refresh on logon.
segment.target: Triggers a global publishing refresh on logon.

segment.source: This setting cannot be modified using the set-AppvclientConfiguration cmdLet.
segment.target: This setting cannot be modified using the set-AppvclientConfiguration cmdLet.

segment.source: You must use the Set-AppvPublishingServer cmdlet.
segment.target: You must use the Set-AppvPublishingServer cmdlet.

segment.source: Specifies the publishing refresh interval using the GlobalRefreshIntervalUnit.
segment.target: Specifies the publishing refresh interval using the GlobalRefreshIntervalUnit.

segment.source: This setting cannot be modified using the set-AppvclientConfiguration cmdLet.
segment.target: This setting cannot be modified using the set-AppvclientConfiguration cmdLet.

segment.source: You must use the Set-AppvPublishingServer cmdlet.
segment.target: You must use the Set-AppvPublishingServer cmdlet.

segment.source: This setting cannot be modified using the set-AppvclientConfiguration cmdLet.
segment.target: This setting cannot be modified using the set-AppvclientConfiguration cmdLet.

segment.source: You must use the Set-AppvPublishingServer cmdlet.
segment.target: You must use the Set-AppvPublishingServer cmdlet.

segment.source: This setting cannot be modified using the set-AppvclientConfiguration cmdLet.
segment.target: This setting cannot be modified using the set-AppvclientConfiguration cmdLet.

segment.source: You must use the Set-AppvPublishingServer cmdlet.
segment.target: You must use the Set-AppvPublishingServer cmdlet.

segment.source: Triggers a user publishing refresh onlogon.
segment.target: Triggers a user publishing refresh onlogon.

segment.source: This setting cannot be modified using the set-AppvclientConfiguration cmdLet.
segment.target: This setting cannot be modified using the set-AppvclientConfiguration cmdLet.

segment.source: You must use the Set-AppvPublishingServer cmdlet.
segment.target: You must use the Set-AppvPublishingServer cmdlet.

segment.source: Specifies the publishing refresh interval using the UserRefreshIntervalUnit.
segment.target: Specifies the publishing refresh interval using the UserRefreshIntervalUnit.

segment.source: This setting cannot be modified using the set-AppvclientConfiguration cmdLet.
segment.target: This setting cannot be modified using the set-AppvclientConfiguration cmdLet.

segment.source: You must use the Set-AppvPublishingServer cmdlet.
segment.target: You must use the Set-AppvPublishingServer cmdlet.

segment.source: Migration mode allows the App-V client to modify shortcuts and FTA’s for packages created using a previous version of App-V.
segment.target: Migration mode allows the App-V client to modify shortcuts and FTA’s for packages created using a previous version of App-V.

segment.source: Allows the computer running the App-V 5.0 Client to collect and return certain usage information to help allow us to further improve the application.
segment.target: Allows the computer running the App-V 5.0 Client to collect and return certain usage information to help allow us to further improve the application.

segment.source: Enables scripts defined in the package manifest of configuration files that should run.
segment.target: Enables scripts defined in the package manifest of configuration files that should run.

segment.source: Specifies the file paths relative to %userprofile% that do not roam with a user's profile.
segment.target: Specifies the file paths relative to %userprofile% that do not roam with a user's profile.

segment.source: Specifies the registry paths that do not roam with a user profile.
segment.target: Specifies the registry paths that do not roam with a user profile.

segment.source: Policy value not written (same as Not Configured)
segment.target: Policy value not written (same as Not Configured)

segment.source: Specifies the location to create symbolic links associated with the current version of a per-user published package.
segment.target: Specifies the location to create symbolic links associated with the current version of a per-user published package.

segment.source: all virtual application extensions, for example shortcuts and file type associations, will point to this path.
segment.target: all virtual application extensions, for example shortcuts and file type associations, will point to this path.

segment.source: If you do not specify a path, symbolic links will not be used when you publish the package.
segment.target: If you do not specify a path, symbolic links will not be used when you publish the package.

segment.source: Policy value not written (same as Not Configured)
segment.target: Policy value not written (same as Not Configured)

segment.source: Specifies the location to create symbolic links associated with the current version of a globally published package.
segment.target: Specifies the location to create symbolic links associated with the current version of a globally published package.

segment.source: all virtual application extensions, for example shortcuts and file type associations, will point to this path.
segment.target: all virtual application extensions, for example shortcuts and file type associations, will point to this path.

segment.source: If you do not specify a path, symbolic links will not be used when you publish the package.
segment.target: If you do not specify a path, symbolic links will not be used when you publish the package.

segment.source: Policy value not written (same as Not Configured)
segment.target: Policy value not written (same as Not Configured)

segment.source: A comma -delineated list of file name extensions that can be used to determine if a locally installed application can be run in the virtual environment.
segment.target: A comma -delineated list of file name extensions that can be used to determine if a locally installed application can be run in the virtual environment.

segment.source: When shortcuts, FTAs, and other extension points are created during publishing, App-V will compare the file name extension to the list if the application that is associated with the extension point is locally installed.
segment.target: When shortcuts, FTAs, and other extension points are created during publishing, App-V will compare the file name extension to the list if the application that is associated with the extension point is locally installed.

segment.source: If the extension is located, the RunVirtual command line parameter will be added, and the application will run virtually.
segment.target: If the extension is located, the RunVirtual command line parameter will be added, and the application will run virtually.

segment.source: For more information about the RunVirtual parameter, see Running a Locally Installed Application Inside a Virtual Environment with Virtualized Applications.
segment.target: For more information about the RunVirtual parameter, see Running a Locally Installed Application Inside a Virtual Environment with Virtualized Applications.

segment.source: Enables the client to return information to a reporting server.
segment.target: Enables the client to return information to a reporting server.

segment.source: Specifies the location on the reporting server where client information is saved.
segment.target: Specifies the location on the reporting server where client information is saved.

segment.source: Policy value not written (same as Not Configured)
segment.target: Policy value not written (same as Not Configured)

segment.source: Specifies the maximum size in megabytes (MB) of the XML cache for storing reporting information.
segment.target: Specifies the maximum size in megabytes (MB) of the XML cache for storing reporting information.

segment.source: The size applies to the cache in memory.
segment.target: The size applies to the cache in memory.

segment.source: When the limit is reached, the log file will roll over.
segment.target: When the limit is reached, the log file will roll over.

segment.source: Policy value not written (same as Not Configured)
segment.target: Policy value not written (same as Not Configured)

segment.source: Specifies the maximum size in bytes to transmit to the server for reporting upload requests.
segment.target: Specifies the maximum size in bytes to transmit to the server for reporting upload requests.

segment.source: This can help avoid permanent transmission failures when the log has reached a significant size.
segment.target: This can help avoid permanent transmission failures when the log has reached a significant size.

segment.source: Policy value not written (same as Not Configured)
segment.target: Policy value not written (same as Not Configured)

segment.source: Specifies the time to initiate the client to send data to the reporting server.
segment.target: Specifies the time to initiate the client to send data to the reporting server.

segment.source: You must specify a valid integer between 0-23 corresponding to the hour of the day.
segment.target: You must specify a valid integer between 0-23 corresponding to the hour of the day.

segment.source: By default the ReportingStartTime will start on the current day at 10 P.M.or 22.
segment.target: By default the ReportingStartTime will start on the current day at 10 P.M.or 22.

segment.source: You should configure this setting to a time when computers running the App-V 5.0 client are least likely to be offline.
segment.target: You should configure this setting to a time when computers running the App-V 5.0 client are least likely to be offline.

segment.source: Policy value not written (same as Not Configured)
segment.target: Policy value not written (same as Not Configured)

segment.source: Specifies the retry interval that the client will use to resend data to the reporting server.
segment.target: Specifies the retry interval that the client will use to resend data to the reporting server.

segment.source: Policy value not written (same as Not Configured)
segment.target: Policy value not written (same as Not Configured)

segment.source: Specifies the maximum delay (in minutes) for data to be sent to the reporting server.
segment.target: Specifies the maximum delay (in minutes) for data to be sent to the reporting server.

segment.source: When the scheduled task is started, the client generates a random delay between 0 and ReportingRandomDelay and will wait the specified duration before sending data.
segment.target: When the scheduled task is started, the client generates a random delay between 0 and ReportingRandomDelay and will wait the specified duration before sending data.

segment.source: This can help to prevent collisions on the server.
segment.target: This can help to prevent collisions on the server.

segment.source: Policy value not written (same as Not Configured)
segment.target: Policy value not written (same as Not Configured)

segment.source: This setting is available only with App-V 5.0 SP2 or later.
segment.target: This setting is available only with App-V 5.0 SP2 or later.

segment.source: Enables supported Shell Extensions, Browser Helper Objects, and Active X controls to be virtualized and run with virtual applications.
segment.target: Enables supported Shell Extensions, Browser Helper Objects, and Active X controls to be virtualized and run with virtual applications.

segment.source: This setting is available only with App-V 5.0 SP2.
segment.target: This setting is available only with App-V 5.0 SP2.

segment.source: Enables the publishing refresh progress bar for the computer running the App-V 5.0 Client.
segment.target: Enables the publishing refresh progress bar for the computer running the App-V 5.0 Client.

segment.source: This setting is available only with App-V 5.0 SP2.
segment.target: This setting is available only with App-V 5.0 SP2.

segment.source: Hides the publishing refresh progress bar.
segment.target: Hides the publishing refresh progress bar.

segment.source: Specifies a list of process paths (that may contain wildcards), which are candidates for using dynamic virtualization (supported shell extensions, browser helper objects, and ActiveX controls).
segment.target: Specifies a list of process paths (that may contain wildcards), which are candidates for using dynamic virtualization (supported shell extensions, browser helper objects, and ActiveX controls).

segment.source: Only processes whose full path matches one of these items can use dynamic virtualization.
segment.target: Only processes whose full path matches one of these items can use dynamic virtualization.

segment.source: Add or vote on suggestions here.
segment.target: Add or vote on suggestions here.

segment.source: For App-V issues, use the App-V TechNet Forum.
segment.target: For App-V issues, use the App-V TechNet Forum.
